content.raw:
We have been naming release branches like `gazebo_X.Y` (`gazebo_1.9`, `gazebo_2.2`, `gazebo_3.1`, etc.). When we release a new minor version, we create a new branch and basically the previous minors (ie. after `gazebo_3.1` no patch releases to `gazebo_3.0`).

If we are only going to maintain one branch for each major version, I would propose naming our branches without the minor number (ie. `gazeboX`). It would simplify our branching. We could still go back and create a minor branch if needed, but we could default to keeping it simple.

So, when we are ready to branch for gazebo 5.0, can we call the branch `gazebo5`?
